column7: The Senior Recital represents the final applied music project for students studying music performance or music composition. A public recital is given during the senior year. 0 undergraduate hours. No graduate credit. Approved for S/U grading only. May be repeated if recital program differs, and with permission of applied music instructor. Prerequisite: Minimum of six semesters of applied music study, concurrent enrollment in the appropriate 400-level applied music course, and permission of the applied music instructor. Music performance majors must have completed MUSC 300.
